form_submitted.title: Account created successfully!
form_submitted.content:
Your new account has been created, but you need to confirm it in order to gain access to it.

Please check your e-mail account (or the alternate e-mail account if you've provided it) using this same device and not a different one and follow instructions there within the next hour.

Important: our e-mail could be flagged as spam by your e-mail provider. If you can't find it in your inbox, please check in the spam/unwanted folder.

If the e-mail doesn't arrive after a few minutes, try logging in to have the email resent. If it still doesn't arrive, please contact us for further assistance.

If you don't validate your account within an hour and the token expires, a new token will be sent if you try to login again.
If the account is not activated after 12 hours, it will be deleted.

specs.title: Hide birthdate input on registration form?
specs.description: Birthdate input is not mandatory. It can be hidden if you don't use it.

specs.title: Allow duplicate emails?
specs.description:
Allow users to register more than one account with the same email address.
Important: this only applies for registraion. Setting duplicate emails on profile updates isn't allowed.

specs.title: Custom registration banner code
specs.description: Type HTML code that you want to be shown above the registration page

specs.title: Disable registrations widget?
specs.description: Show/hide the registrations widget chart on top of the accounts browser.

specs.title: Automatic user names
specs.description:
Disables user name introduction on the registration form and builds it automatically.
Note: this applies only at the moment of account creation. The field is sown read-only on the profile editing form.

specs.title: Hide origin country selector on creation?
specs.description: If "Yes", the country selector is hidden on the registration form and is taken from the IP. Note: this applies only at the moment of account creation. The field is sown read-only on the profile editing form.

specs.title: Enforce device registration
specs.description:
If enabled, users will have to confirm every browser they open the website in.
Use it only if you want strict account security.

specs.title: Default user profile banner
specs.description: By default, the engine comes with a generic profile banner: {$full_root_url}/media/default_user_banner.jpg. You can specify another one here.

specs.title: User names blacklist
specs.description:
List of user names that are not allowed when a user tries to register an account.
Type one word per each line. You can disable entries by adding a # at the beginning of the line.
The next wildcards are supported: ? for a single character or * for any characters.
Note: comparison is not case sensitive.

specs.title: Display names blacklist
specs.description:
List of user display names that are not allowed when users try to register an account or edit their profiles.
Type one word per each line. You can disable entries by adding a # at the beginning of the line.
The next wildcards are supported: ? for a single character or * for any characters.
Note: comparison is not case sensitive.

specs.title: Email domains blacklist
specs.description:
List of domains that aren't allowed on email fields when registering or editing an account.
You can find disposable domain lists for copy/paste here:
  • github.com/martenson/.../disposable_email_blacklist.conf
  • gist.github.com/hassanazimi/d6e49469258d7d06f9f4
Type one domain per each line. You can disable entries by adding a # at the beginning.
Note: this list may be ignored by automated account creation enabled modules.

specs.title: API keys support
specs.description:
When enabled, this setting extends the user profile editing page with an API key pair generator.
Note: API keys support is not needed unless a module specifically requires it. In such case, is it possible that any module should enable this setting if you manually disable it.

specs.title: Access level required to use API keys
specs.description: By default, newcomers can use the API keys support when enabled.
